page.title: 12LANDSCAPE, CHITTERNE
page.content: The area is on the south western edge of Salisbury Plain, part of it in the Imber Live Firing Danger Zone. The landscape is rolling chalk downland used for agriculture as well as military training. There are also the sites of Romano-British settlements, "castles", and ancient barrows, tumuli and earthworks in the area. Apart from a few belts of trees, mainly beech, planted for agricultural protection, the countryside is bare of hedges and trees. This northern part of Chitterne lies on either side of the road curling northwards up the valley to the open Plain.
